item.title: Govt calls for sensible conduct ahead of election
item.description: The interim government has called on all citizens to act with the highest sense of responsibility and cooperation to ensure a festive, peaceful, and participatory national election. In a statement issued on Friday following unrest near the Chief Adviser's residence, the government described the up

item.title: JUCSU VP Jitu joins BNP
item.description: Abdur Rashid Zitu, vice-president (VP) of the Jahangirnagar University Central Students' Union (JUCSU), has formally joined the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP). Alongside him, several representatives from different hall unions of the university joined the Jatiyatabadi Chatra Dal (JCD), the stud

item.title: Over 0.15m postal ballots reach returning officers
item.description: A total of 1,55,452 (over 0.15 million) postal ballots have already reached the returning officers across the country ahead of the 13th parliamentary election, scheduled for February 12. Of them, 1,24,746 ballots have been received from expatriate voters staying abroad and 30,706 others come from v

item.title: ADB may provide $300m in 2nd tranche for delayed Dhaka-Sylhet highway
item.description: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) is likely to provide the second-tranche loan worth US$300 million for the long-delayed Dhaka-Sylhet Highway construction project, which has been struggling for five years, officials said on Friday. "We are going to sit in negotiations with the ADB on February 9 to

item.title: Ctg election fever peaks before Feb 12
item.description: Election fever has gripped Chattogram ahead of the 13th Jatiya Sangsad (JS) election slated for 12 February. Campaigning by candidates and discussions among voters are at their peak, with supporters of candidates in the city's 16 constituencies holding processions almost daily. Both candidates and

item.title: Natâ€™l telehealth helpline 16263 faces shutdown amid funding crisis
item.description: Bangladesh's flagship public telehealth service, Shastho Batayan 16263, which has served as a critical healthcare lifeline for millions, is facing an uncertain future due to prolonged funding delays and administrative bottlenecks, triggering concern among health experts, service providers and polic

item.title: BNP to pursue balanced regional dev for equitable wealth distribution
item.description: BNP chairman Tarique Rahman has outlined the BNP's vision for region-specific development for balanced national uplift, youth-focused culture and inclusive growth in his party's election manifesto. Tarique Rahman unveiled his party's broad development vision, placing balanced regional growth, yout

item.title: H1 sales of saving tools return to positive territory at Tk 24.61b
item.description: The net sales of state-run savings instruments returned to positive territory in the first half of the current fiscal year 2025-26 with savers showing growing interest in the secured investment tools. According to the latest Bangladesh Bank (BB) data, net sales of the savings tools stood at Tk 24.

item.title: Navigating fog is like driving blindfolded
item.description: GENERAL EXPERIENCE OF DRIVING IN FOG From the cab, we do not see the tracks ahead. It just looks like a white wall, and we drive through that. Navigating fog is like driving blindfolded. We sound the whistle frequently, at least four times in a minute. Depending on fog density, we drive at reduced

item.title: A Divided World
item.description: In spite of all philosophical and technological advances, the world today is as divided as it was centuries ago. We look at some areas of this division. We are an impatient nation. In a traffic jam on highways, it is very common to see drivers veer into the opposite lane and thus create a roadbloc

item.title: Learning a lesson of cosmopolitanism in the capital
item.description: Is Bangladesh a nation of forgers? When such denigration comes from none other than the head of the government, one who is a recipient of the highest award on offer in the world, people cannot but look askance. In fact, any generalised perception of any race, people or nation is faulty. But this ki

item.title: Fortune Shoes stock price manipulation: FID seeks list of ICB employees involved
item.description: The Financial Institutions Division (FID) has asked the Bangladesh Securities and Exchange Commission (BSEC) to provide a list of Investment Corporation of Bangladesh (ICB) employees allegedly involved in the manipulation of stock price of Fortune Shoes Ltd.
